00034 // jhrg 2/3/96

00069 struct parser_arg {
00070     void *_object;      // nominally a pointer to an object
00071     Error *_error;      // a pointer to an Error object
00072     int _status;        // parser status
00073 
00074     parser_arg() : _object(0), _error(0), _status(1) {}
00075     parser_arg(void *obj) : _object(obj), _error(0), _status(1) {}
00076     virtual ~parser_arg() {
00077     if (_error) {
00078         delete _error; _error = 0;
00079     }
00080     }
00081 
00082     void *object() { return _object; }
00083     void set_object(void *obj) { _object = obj; }
00084     Error *error() { return _error; }
00085     void set_error(Error *obj) { _error = obj; }
00086     int status() { return _status; }
00087     void set_status(int val = 0) { _status = val; }
00088 };
00089 
00092 struct gse_arg {
00093     GSEClause *_gsec;       // The gse parsed.
00094     Grid *_grid;        // The Grid being constrained.
00095     int _status;        // The parser's status.
00096 
00097     gse_arg(): _gsec(0), _grid(0), _status(1) {}
00098     gse_arg(Grid *g): _gsec(0), _grid(g), _status(1) {}
00099     virtual ~gse_arg() {}
00100 
00101     void set_gsec(GSEClause *gsec) { _gsec = gsec; }
00102     GSEClause *get_gsec() { return _gsec; }
00103     void set_grid(Grid *g) { _grid = g; }
00104     Grid *get_grid() { return _grid; }
00105     void set_status(int stat) { _status = stat; }
00106     int get_status() { return _status; }
00107 };

00213 // Revision 1.14.4.3  2001/07/28 01:10:42  jimg
00214 // Some of the numeric type classes did not have copy ctors or operator=.
00215 // I added those where they were needed.
00216 // In every place where delete (or delete []) was called, I set the pointer
00217 // just deleted to zero. Thus if for some reason delete is called again
00218 // before new memory is allocated there won't be a mysterious crash. This is
00219 // just good form when using delete.
00220 // I added calls to www2id and id2www where appropriate. The DAP now handles
00221 // making sure that names are escaped and unescaped as needed. Connect is
00222 // set to handle CEs that contain names as they are in the dataset (see the
00223 // comments/Log there). Servers should not handle escaping or unescaping
00224 // characters on their own.
00225 //
00226 // Revision 1.14.4.2  2001/06/23 00:47:51  jimg
00227 // Added is_keyword(). This is used to test an ID to see if it's a keyword.
00228 // This was added because the dds.y grammar had to be changed when `:' was
00229 // added to the set of characters allowed in ID names. See dds.y.
